results.title: 'Where dead men lie': spotlight the director
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Chris McGill, Richard Mason and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the production of “Where dead men lie”, highlighting the role of the director, Keith Gow. This film shows his involvement in screen testing, location shooting, editing and mixing. Suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: Stirring the pool
results.creator_credit: Wayne Le Clos, Gil Brealey, Peter Weir, Commonwealth Public Service Board and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel or People”.
A new typist is asked to do a job for the manager instead of the senior typist, who is not present. Afterwards the senior typist voices her resentment, causing the new girl to feel unhappy. Another typist informs the new typist that the attitude of the senior typist is not new and has caused many resignations. What is the answer to internal warfare in the typing pool? Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: School's in, Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Martyn Down, Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Russian Education”.
Examines the present school system in the Soviet Union. Demonstrates the style of Soviet teaching which is fairly rigid and formal, with the emphasis on teacher dominated instruction and passive pupils, responding only when instructed to do so. A more flexible teaching style was introduced some years ago but was later abandoned. Photographer, Dean Semler; script, Roger Milliss; editor, Martyn Down; sound, George Hart, Howard Spry; commentator, Margaret Throsby.

results.title: Queensland Centenary Story, 1859-1959
results.creator_credit: Judy Campbell, Dulcie Holland, Eric Thompson, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A brief account of the first hundred years of Queensland’s history, touching on its social life, its connection with two world wars, its industries and its agricultural and pastoral pursuits. Many sequences of historical intrest - in particular the visit of the Prince of Wales in 1921 and the Trans-Pacific flight by Sir Charles Kingsford Smith.

results.title: Pace
results.creator_credit: Brian Woods, Yoram Gross, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Over 300 years old, the modern sport of trotting was established when the English stallion, Messenger, was imported into the U.S.A. in 1788. About the turn of the century, quality stock arrived in Australia and New Zealand. With skilful breeding, these trotters and pacers rank among the world’s best. In this transformation into a trotter from birth, to breaking school, to racetrack debut, is followed. Filmed at Carlton Stud, Picton, N.S.W., and various Sydney trotting tracks. No narration.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Woods, Yoram Gross, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Olives don't float
results.creator_credit: Peter McKinley, Edwin Moses, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Peter Cummins plays an experienced seafarer who surveys the people and boats in the bay and points out the good and bad safety features of the various craft, their pilots and passengers. Production Manager: Penny Chapman. Cast includes: Frank Banset, Ray Sangston, Nino Ceron, Peter Eldridge, Jan Kuplis, Christine Ellison, Peter McKinley, Sven Kuplis, Julian Harvey, Peter Lewis.

results.title: Ned Kelly: paintings by Sidney Nolan
results.creator_credit: Alan Harkness, Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s best known bushranger is told through the paintings of Sidney Nolan, accompanied by a ballad played on the guitar. Made with the co-operation of the Museum of Modern Art of Australia.

results.title: Minh: a Vietnamese
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia. Minh talks about his life and hopes for his children in his new country.

results.title: Language at twelve (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Frazer, Karl McPhee, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Watch Your Language”.
Intended primarily to emphasise the diversity and complexity of language in the life of a 12-year-old. This film focuses on two 12-year-olds who are involved in a school language project. Shows their interaction with a sufficient number of significant people in their lives for us to gain an impression of how the demands upon their speech shift. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Frazer, Karl McPhee, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 2. Varieties
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Shows some of the variously adapted species of kangaroos in their natural environments: rat Kangaroos, quokkas, tree kangaroos, forest wallabies, rock wallabies and others.
